origination.persname: Trafton, Robert M. (Robert McIntosh), b. 1847 and Herbert L. Dorr

did.unittitle: Robert Trafton and Herbert Dorr Biographical Sketches
did.abstract: The collection consists of two biographical sketches produced by an unknown author: one of Robert McIntosh Trafton and one of Herbert L. Dorr. The men were owners of the Trafton-Dorr Company in Malta, Montana.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of two biographical sketches produced by an unknown author: one of Robert McIntosh Trafton and one of Herbert L. Dorr. Trafton founded the Malta, Montana, store later known as the Trafton-Dorr Company; Dorr was its second owner after Trafton retired in 1912. The sketches give not only details of these two mens’ accomplishments, but offer a brief sketch of life and commerce in Malta and Phillips county in the late nineteenth and early twentieth centuries.

accessrestrict.p: Researchers must use collection in accordance with the policies of Archives and Special Collections, the Maureen and Mike Mansfield Library, and the University of Montana--Missoula.

userestrict.p: Researchers are responsible for using in accordance with 17 U.S.C. and any other applicable statutes. Copyright not transferred to the University of Montana.

prefercite.p: [Name of document or photograph number], Robert Trafton and Herbert Dorr Biographical Sketches, Archives and Special Collections, The University of Montana-Missoula.

custodhist.p: The collection was donated by Herbert L. Dorr to the University of Montana History Department in 1966.

acqinfo.p: In 1967, the collection was transferred to the University of Montana Archives.

processinfo.p: The actions of the original processors are unknown; the collection was numbered SC 3. In 1998, the collection was re-described and re-numbered as Mss 016. In 2004, the finding aid was encoded.

controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the online catalog. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons, or places should search the catalog using these headings.
